result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Anthony J Broncatti Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety. Random U.A.'s. No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription, or drug paraphernalia

Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No Violent contact with: Victim

Attend Victim Impact Panel: 11-9-2022

No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores)

No Operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Delafield Police Department.

timeConds.notes: Huber with Standard Release Conditions. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 9 days was granted.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 2:48 PM
Attorney Alissa Schaller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Anthony J Broncatti Jr.  
Defendant Anthony J Broncatti Jr in court.  
State files a 2nd Amended Information.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.
Count 4 is dismissed by Operation of Law.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  48 MONTHS
Initial Confinement:  24 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  24 MONTHS
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent contact with: Victim
Attend Victim Impact Panel: 11-9-2022
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores)
No Operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license

CONDITION TIME: 12-MONTHS HUBER (all standard release conditions)
Defendant is taken into custody from the courtroom.
Credit time 9-days.

FINE: $5,833.00
IGNITION INTERLOCK DEVICE  $50.00 
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $3.05 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Delafield Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:18 AM   File not called on the record.
Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Anthony J Broncatti in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer. 
Attorney Nimmer requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CONDITIONS:
Huber Bailee Status
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Comply with all licensing restrictions. 
Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store, except place of employment.
Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.
Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services unless otherwise ordered by the court.
Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring. 
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision. 
The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. 
Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim in case #22 CF 31 listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
